column4: I've spent all day trying to get this wireless working, could someone please help me? My wireless (wlan0) shows up, but when I enter in my SSID it just stays at "Attempting to connect to wireless" then fails out after a couple minutes with no error message.
lol danand_ you're still here too?
I know what you mean, after asking for like 2 solid hours straight with either no response, or someone getting you started on something then leave you have to take a break.
- i spent about a week getting wireless working with my debian laptop ... i know how you feel. Have you tried working through the stuff on that web page to set up your wireless?
I've spent the past hour looking at the wifidocs, it appears that all is well with the setup. Just don't know why it won't work :(
- how is your card working? ndiswrapper, kernel module?
I did an lsmod for prism2_usb and it's all there, even shows up in network tools.
I just installed the linux-wlan-ng package, going to reboot and see if it fixes it hehe
no love with the linux-wlan-ng package lol
- alternative - buy a plug in card thats supported :)
I could do that, but I was laid off work recently so I have no monies lol
- i just got made redundant too ... :( ... lousy job anyway :)
